Automated parameter sweep for Seurat clustering

Source: R/seurat_utils.R
clustering.Rd

This function performs iterative clustering across a range of neighbor parameters (k.param) and resolution values. For each valid clustering result (based on the number of clusters), it generates a DimPlot annotated with cluster counts and saves all plots to a PDF file.

clustering(
  object,
  reduction = "pca",
  k_range,
  resolution_range,
  dims,
  clusters_min = 5,
  clusters_max = 8,
  colors = NULL,
  output_file = "dimplot.pdf"
)

Arguments

object

A Seurat object.

reduction

dimensional reduction to be used. Default is "pca".

k_range

Numeric vector specifying the range of k.param values to test in FindNeighbors().

resolution_range

Numeric vector specifying the range of resolution values to test in FindClusters().

dims

Integer vector of principal components to use in neighbor finding.

clusters_min

Minimum acceptable number of clusters for a valid result. Defaults to a user-specified value.

clusters_max

Maximum acceptable number of clusters for a valid result. Defaults to a user-specified value.

colors

Optional vector of colors for clusters in plots.

output_file

PDF file name to save all DimPlots. Default: "dimplot.pdf".

Value

A Seurat object with additional metadata columns for each valid clustering. A PDF file (dimplot.pdf) containing all DimPlots is also saved.

Details

For each combination of k.param and resolution, the function runs:

  1. FindNeighbors(object, dims = dims, k.param = k)

  2. FindClusters(object, resolution = r)

It then checks if the resulting number of clusters is between clusters_min and clusters_max. If so, a DimPlot is created with labeled clusters and saved to a combined PDF file named dimplot.pdf.

Each accepted clustering is also stored in the Seurat object metadata under a column named "k<k>_r<r>" (e.g., "k20_r0.8").

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
seurat_obj <- clustering(
  object = seurat_obj,
  k_range = 10:30,
  resolution_range = seq(0.2, 1.2, by = 0.2),
  dims = 1:20,
  clusters_min = 5,
  clusters_max = 20
)
} # }
